message_1: If $a=5$ and $b=7$, solve for $x$ in the equation $5^x \equiv 7 \pmod{19}$.
message_2:
To solve the equation $5^x \equiv 7 \pmod{19}$, we can use the discrete logarithm. We are looking for an integer $x$ such that:

$5^x \equiv 7 \pmod{19}$

We can start by listing the powers of 5 modulo 19:

$5^1 \equiv 5 \pmod{19}$

$5^2 \equiv 25 \equiv 6 \pmod{19}$

$5^3 \equiv 5 \cdot 6 \equiv 30 \equiv 11 \pmod{19}$

$5^4 \equiv 5 \cdot 11 \equiv 55 \equiv 17 \pmod{19}$

$5^5 \equiv 5 \cdot 17 \equiv 85 \equiv 9 \pmod{19}$

$5^6 \equiv 5 \cdot 9 \equiv 45 \equiv 7 \pmod{19}$

We found that $5^6 \equiv 7 \pmod{19}$. Therefore, $x = 6$ is the solution to the equation.
